moves.1. d4: Recently I choose 1.d4 opening to train my skills in closed games
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Bg5: Torre attack I guess? I like it - it's solid and aggressive at the same time
moves.3... Nbd7: I'm not sure but maybe 3...e6 is better here - it would develop the k-bishop
moves.4. e3 a6: Black maybe preparing for b5 and then fianchetting the Q-bishop
moves.5... b6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. O-O e6 8. Nbd2 Be7: Good base for eventual queen side attack later. At the same time it opens c2 pole for the Queen
moves.10... c5: Weak try to threaten the white queen side position. Nothing to worry about
moves.11. Ne5: Now White has opened diagonals for the queen and white pole bishop, option for attacking with f-pawn, and good placed Knight. In the other hand if 11...N7xe5 then 12.dxe5 and good game for White again
moves.11... c4: Actually this is a better move for White conception
moves.13. e4 Nxe5 14. dxe5 Nd7 15. Bxe7 Qxe7 1: Obviously better than exd5. Now White has occupied the center
moves.17... g6 18. exd5: To open the too important diagonal for the bishop
moves.18... Bxd5 19. Qg4 h5 20. Qh3 Kg7 21. Rg: To not allow g5 and to close Black Queen e7-h4 diagonal. At the same time to open place for g4
moves.22... Rfg8 23. Qh4: A little trap for the black queen but my opponent revealed it...
moves.27... Qc5+ 28. Kf1 Rd7 29. Ke1: To avoid eventualy fork by Bg2+ after Qxd3
moves.29... Kh7 30. Rc1: A little trick - the basic idea is to get out the bishop and to free b3 for the Knight
moves.30... Bc6 31. Qh3 Kg7 32. Rg3: Good move - if white Queen attacks, the rook will prevent checks from the black Queen. At the same time the pressure on d3 is stronger
moves.32... Rd4: Black answers with threat on f4 but it isn't important already. Now White are ready for attack
moves.33. hxg6 fxg6 34. Qxe6 Kf8 35. Qf6+ Ke8: And Black resigns. Thanks for watching
